subject: Pretty Dany Moneyeyes
event:
This wild ride I have been on for this last decade just keeps getting wilder.

The amount of GAME OF THRONES stuff out there boggles even me.   

Here's the latest:

<lj-embed id="744"/>

I have not seen this one in person myself.   I understand there is one at the Sky City casino down near Acoma, west of Albuquerque.   Whether Sandia or Camel Rock or any of the other Indian casinos nearby have them I don't know, though I suspect they do.

I don't go to casinos very often, and when I do I prefer to play poker or blackjack with other human beings rather than the slots, but I'd play this one.   In fact, I want one for myself.  Though I have no idea whether it is even legal for an individual to own a slot machine, or if you need a casino to be able to have one.   

(I do have the GAME OF THRONES pinball machine.  Which is very cool itself).

What's next, you ask?   No idea...

comments.article: I have seen this machine in Vegas. I even lost $10 on it ! I felt it had to be played though.

Hi George! How are you?

Can you answer a question? What is the name of Doran's parents? Which house was his father?
http://gameofthrones.wikia.com/wiki/Dora<wbr />n_Martell
comments.subject: Doran Martell

comments.article: ?? Never once picked up on that... Regardless, this doesn't seem like the right venue unless you're just trolling...
comments.subject: Re: ASOIAF

comments.article: With my luck some red head would tell me I needed to get 3 of Stannis in a row to get the big prize, when really it was the Stark bastard I'd been ignoring all game that gives the jackpot.
comments.subject: The Prize that was Promised

comments.upictitle: let's get the seven lines.: pic#88389468
comments.article: I just spotted this game in a Vegas casino this weekend! Next to the Walking Dead game, the House of Cards Game, and, our fave, the Orange is the New Black game.
I'm just not sure how to respond to this.

I was waiting for an ADWD anniversary post 😭
Maybe with a good quote by my fav storyline from it: Jon/"Arya"

A girl can dream.
comments.subject: Adwd anniversary

comments.article:
I wonder what the iron bank would think of that one, eh?
That's awesome. And I thought I was being wild when I bought the GAME OF THRONES Monopoly game! A pinball machine, that's where it's at, George! I gotta keep an eye out for those slots if I'm done being a hermit.

There's an online version. And I'm sure you'll be pleased to learn from the manufacturer that the physical version won "Best Slot Product in the 15th Annual Gaming & Technology Awards in 2015" (and now you know whom to contact to try to get one for yourself :-> )
I don't gamble.  But I would donate some money to this machine.
comments.subject: Slot Machine

comments.article: GAME OF THRONES MMORPG? ;)
comments.subject: What's next, you ask?

comments.upictitle: Daphne Iapetus: james dean marilyn monroe
comments.article: I would love a MMORPG of ASoIaF/GoT! Well, as long as I could use a controller with it, lol.
comments.subject: Re: What's next, you ask?
RE: Re: What's next, you ask?
Re: No idea what happened to that.

comments.article: Hope the proceeds go towards paying off the crown's debt.  I hear those Braavosi don't mess around when it comes to money...
GRRM - they also have the GOT slot machine in Vegas and Atlantic City.
comments.subject: Also

comments.article: Do they need to get licencing rights off you and HBO before they make them?  Surely IP and copy right applies esp as they are using images of the actors.

It's cool in a strange way. I would definitely leave a few more bucks in Vegas if I saw one.

I can't imagine how surreal it is for you to see your babies, characters you have lived with for over 20 years (happy anniversary!) suddenly becoming celebrities in their own right, with their faces plastered everywhere.

Seven hells! I won a talking plush doll made in the likeness of you in a competition. I can't fathom how bizarre it must be for a boy from Bayonne to see a talking figurine of himself.

What I can tell you is that it's impossible not to smile when you see the doll atop my bookshelf, so enjoy the craziness.

They have that game in Detroit. Its my fav. I like slot machines with a lit of action and this one has it. They have a random feature where Dany says Dracarys and Drogon comes on the screen and lights the reels on fire, very entertaining.

many of them seem to have age restrictions. not yours or mine, but the machine's age.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_state_slot_machine_ownership_regulations

new mexico, right? seems you'll have one just in time to celebrate a dream of spring :)
comments.subject: wins of winter

comments.upictitle: Prof. Jeremy M. R. F. Chesterfield-Pickles III: Glykon Ikon!
comments.article:
I saw a set of these in Vegas a few weekends back, when I was staying in Meereen the Luxor. As I am much more a "drink and know things" person than a gambler, however, I did not play it, though I did stop and look at it longer than I did any other slot machine…much to the chagrin of the people playing it at the time. (Slot players seem so antisocial, alas…!?!)

It may be cliche, but nonetheless, I must in this situation: I think with your writing's success and the cultural pervasiveness of your stories and characters now, one can say you've hit the jackpot. And now I will be thoroughly thrashed for having said something so ridiculous. ;)

Speaking of games (kind of), one of my favorite games of all time, console, computer and board is The Dark Tower by milton Bradley. A few years back i spent the monies to build a 100% complete set. Upwards of 300$ total. But whatever, its something i enjoy now as much as i did in the 80s. So, a Dark Tower style-aSoIaF board game would be mad sick! JS.
Wonder if they could set it up to give a copy of the books away as a prize.
comments.subject: Prize idea

comments.article: The next?. Dragons airlines, I think... :-D

Ha-ha! :)))
Baratheon Bros. Entertainment Inc.
So what's your favorite piece of GoT merchandise released in the last few years?

I played this at the Red Rock Casino in Vegas (although I think it might technically be in Summerlin, it's quite a ways off of the Strip). There are as many slot machines as there are pop culture phenomena at any given time, and some stick around way longer than is polite (I'm looking at you, Sex In The City).
You can own your own slot machine. My parents had their own. Thwy both loved video poker!
comments.subject: Slot machines

comments.article: There are GoT themed slot machines in Las Vegas too. I've seen them at Mirage and Luxor and I it is probably at other casinos too. Of course I had to play it when I saw one. It didn't treat me so well though. I got the "dracarys" bonus which was fun, but I never got to any of the other bonuses. Next time I go I'll give it another go. You'd be amazed at the number of slot machines they come up with based on tv, movies, etc. The Rolling Stones slot machine is my favorite. I love playing blackjack, but I cannot resist the slot machines for long.
comments.subject: GoT slots in Las Vegas
